decision_conditions: The modifications required to the single storey outbuildings shall be completed in their entirety within three months of the date of this permission.
Reason: To ensure compliance with the approved plans and to ensure that the proposal does not harm the character and appearance of the host building and the surrounding area.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 01 rev 0 (Block & Location Plan),
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | The outbuildings hereby permitted shall be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse at no. 27 & 27 A Church Avenue, Southall, Middlesex, UB2 4DH, and not for any separate residential, industrial, commercial or business use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed into the outbuilding at any time.

REASON: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG 4, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)
description: Construction of a single storey outbuilding to the rear of property (joint application) (retrospective)
